results.title: Duke Ellington and his orchestra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Good years of jazz”.
Features one of the most famous jazz musicians of our time, Duke Ellington leads his orchestra in some his most popular hits. These include: ‘Take the A train, satin Doll, Blow by blow, Things ain’t what they used to be, VIP boogie and Kinda Dukish.’ Ample time is given to solo performances by many of the fine soloists.

results.title: The Louis Armstrong All-Stars
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rubin, Mike Bryan and Storyville Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Good years of jazz”.
Recorded in New York City in 1962 as part of a jazz promotion sponsored by Good Year, this film features a great band playing popular jazz standards. Joining Armstrong on trumpet are Trummy Young on trombone, Billy Kyle on piano and the fabulous Jewel Brown on vocals. Armstrong plays “C’est Si Bon”, “Someday”, “Nobody Knows the Trouble I’ve Seen” and a rousing finale of “When the Saints Go Marching In”.

results.title: The Gold bug
results.creator_credit: Robert Fuest, Doro Bachrach and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Edgar Allan Poe’s story of a young boy on a supposedly deserted island who finds a gold bug and an old piece of paper containing a secret code. He then encounters a crazed old man and his mute servant who are searching for Captain Kidd’s buried treasure.

results.title: People by the billions
results.creator_credit: Donald Faser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
Examines the implications of the population explosion, showing that “standing room only” on our planet may become a possibility as the human race increases. A fanciful notion today, migration to another planet may hold the only hope five hundred years from now.

results.title: Man and his resources
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
What is the responsibility of the “haves” towards the “have nots”? This film examines the growing determination of the poor of the world not to remain poor, and the great twentieth-century concept of shared skills and mutual aid.

results.title: The Good wife of Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Claire Hunt, Kim Longinotto, Channel Four and Twentieth Century Vixen
results.brief_description: When Kazuko Hohki goes back to Tokyo with her avant-garde band, the ‘Frank Chickens’, after living in England for fifteen years, she decides to marry her boyfriend of ten years to please her mother. This wryly observed documentary records her re-experiencing of Japan after a long absence, examining traditional and contemporary attitudes to women and the unconventional lives of her friends. Focusing on Kazuko’s mother and other women who have joined a religion known as ‘The House of Development’, which encourages feelings of self-confidence and individuality the film provides a fresh perspective on the lives of women in contemporary Japanese society. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Can the earth provide?
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
When the earth’s capacity to produce meat and potatoes, wheat, rice or corn is exhausted, will science be able to feed us? Sea plankton, algae, hydroponics, synthetics - all hold great potential for development. But the vital questions are: How much? How soon? Animation: Rene Jodoin, Kaj Pindal Narrated by Stanley Burke.

results.title: The Global struggle for food
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
A progress report on efforts to stave off the threatening crisis in world food supply, to find new ways of feeding the earth’s swelling population. Water control, land redistribution, agricultural advances of all kinds are shown as examples of gains being made to stem the tides of hunger.

results.title: Challenge to mankind
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
Five world-renowned authorities voice their opinion on the threat to mankind of overpopulation, and tender some possible solutions. Views are expressed by Madam Pandit of India, Paul Hoffman of the United States, Lord Boyd Orr of the United Kingdom, Dr Victor Belaunde of Peru and Dr Hugh Keenleyside of Canada. Animation by Rene Jodoin and Kaj Pindal. Narrated by Stanley Burke.

results.title: To each a rightful share
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
This, to the privileged, is a fine-sounding principle; but to the underprivileged it is a call to action. Riots in Africa, India’s violence, China’s new dynamism, Japan’s intense industrialization - all these are seen as part of a great movement. Good historical overview of the rise of industrialization, with particular emphasis on the social affects (the growth in wealth brought on by industrialization).
